message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.SP 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category as the paper deals with encoding and decoding policies to minimize mean-square error under a rate constraint. 
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also likely as the paper deals with a communication scenario where an encoder and decoder are involved in real-time estimation of a stochastic process. 
3. cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with learning the optimal encoding and decoding policies for a given class of continuous Markov processes. 
4. cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with communication between an encoder and decoder. 
5. cs.SP (Signal Processing) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with real-time estimation of a stochastic process using received codewords.
